examples: The bank raised interest rates.
Many shops have raised their prices.
The piece raises the ghosts of a number of twentieth-century art ideas.
The book raises many important questions.
Local residents have raised concerns about late-night noise.
words.defineEn: to put something in a higher place or lift it to a higher position
words.defineVi: để đặt một cái gì đó ở một nơi cao hơn hoặc nâng nó lên một vị trí cao hơn

examples: When it was accused of racism, sexism, anti-environmentalism, it reacted defensively, exacerbating the situation.
How did they react when they learned the news?
The soldier knew that in combat, he who hesitates is lost, and so he trained rigorously to react quickly and decisively in any situation.
I'm not sure how he's going to react when he meets my family!
Our brains react the same way to food.
words.defineEn: to act or behave in a particular way in response to something
words.defineVi: để hành động hoặc cư xử trong một cách cụ thể để đáp ứng với một cái gì đó

examples: She realized that the information in the textbook was incorrect.
She realized that her initial assumption was correct.
I realized I'd been had.
She realized the truth in the saying 'a person with too much ambition cannot sleep in peace.'
After a heated debate, the politicians realized the importance of building bridges and finding common ground for the benefit of the nation.
words.defineEn: to become aware of a situation or fact
words.defineVi: để nhận thức được một tình huống hoặc thực tế

examples: I’d recognize him a mile off in thick fog.
The politician recognized that with great power comes great responsibility, and used their influence to advocate for policies that would benefit the most vulnerable members of society.
The company's management recognized the importance of honoring its traditions while also being open to new ideas and innovations, understanding that tradition is a guide and not a jailer.
The journalist recognized that there were many different opinions on the matter, acknowledging that opinions are like noses, everyone has one.
Coca-Cola is a household name that is recognized around the world.
words.defineEn: to know who a person or what an object is, because we have heard, seen, etc. them before
words.defineVi: để biết một người hoặc một đối tượng là gì, bởi vì chúng tôi đã nghe, nhìn thấy, v.v.

examples: Can you recommend a budget-friendly hotel in the city center?
The herbalist recommended an anise infusion to soothe their upset stomach.
The dentist recommended using an electric toothbrush for better cleaning.
The chef recommended trying the marinated flank steak.
The chef recommended adding a few drops of sesame oil to the dipping sauce for the dumplings.
words.defineEn: to suggest to someone that something is good, convenient, or advantageous; to tell that someone is suitable and useful for a particular task or job
words.defineVi: để gợi ý cho ai đó rằng điều gì đó tốt, thuận tiện hoặc có lợi; để nói rằng ai đó phù hợp và hữu ích cho một nhiệm vụ hoặc công việc cụ thể

examples: She had broken the world 100 meters record.
His new world record will take some beating.
His time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record.
The movie broke all box-office records.
The movie broke box office records in the US.
words.defineEn: to store information, music, etc. in a way that can be used in the future
words.defineVi: để lưu trữ thông tin, âm nhạc, v.v. theo cách có thể được sử dụng trong tương lai

examples: Refer them to therapists in the area.
Carbon capture refers to capturing carbon dioxide emissions at the source.
The emotional part refers to sharing someone else’s feelings.
REPEATEDLY HE REFERRED BACK TO McVEIGH.
Economists often refer to post recession recoveries with a letter.
words.defineEn: to send someone to a doctor, specialist, etc. for help, advice or a decision
words.defineVi: gửi ai đó đến bác sĩ, chuyên gia, v.v. để được giúp đỡ, tư vấn hoặc đưa ra quyết định

examples: With a sharp knife, the chef expertly removed the gristle from the pork chops.
Fast food chains removed pink slime from their menus to regain trust.
The baker skillfully removed the stone from the apricot, preparing it for a delicious pie.
They carefully removed the exocarp of the pomegranate, revealing the clusters of vibrant red arils inside.
I carefully removed the seed coat of the pumpkin seed before roasting it for a tasty snack.
words.defineEn: to take someone or something away from a position
words.defineVi: để đưa một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó ra khỏi một vị trí

examples: The mechanic replaced the rusted bolt with a new one.
They replaced their old toothbrushes with new ones.
For a healthier alternative, she replaced all-purpose flour with whole wheat flour in her muffin recipe.
In my plant-based lasagna, I replaced the meat with textured vegetable protein.
I replaced cocoa powder with carob powder in my favorite cake recipe.
words.defineEn: to put someone or something new instead of someone or something else
words.defineVi: để đặt một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó mới thay vì một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó khác

examples: Journalists on the spot reported no progress.
Their bread and butter is reporting local events.
The paper’s bread and butter is reporting local events in a small community.
The report includes a number of recommendations.
The report showed an increase in sales.
words.defineEn: to give a written or spoken description of an event to someone
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một mô tả bằng văn bản hoặc nói về một sự kiện cho ai đó

examples: The reporter asked the politician a ridiculous question about building a tunnel to the moon, and the politician responded with some nonsense about pink elephants.
You'll have your turn to respond after he's finished.
I need a minute to think about your question before I respond.
The young executive knew that a fool shows his annoyance at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult, so he decided to take a deep breath and respond to the feedback in a constructive way.
In customer service, responding to angry customers in a calm manner can help to resolve the issue more effectively.
words.defineEn: to answer a question in spoken or written form
words.defineVi: để trả lời một câu hỏi ở dạng nói hoặc viết

examples: The name rings a bell.
The children enjoyed onion rings as a crispy side dish.
This should ring alarm bells in all European countries and the United States.
Your phone is ringing for the thousandth time.
His complaints have a familiar ring.
words.defineEn: to make a phone call to someone or attempt to reach them through a phone or other communication device
words.defineVi: gọi điện thoại cho ai đó hoặc cố gắng liên lạc với họ qua điện thoại hoặc thiết bị liên lạc khác

examples: The sun always rises in the east.
The basic pay of the average worker has risen by 3 per cent.
The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.
Tax rises have made some inroads into the country's national debt.
On the credit side, inflation has not risen this year.
words.defineEn: to reach a higher position; to go up
words.defineVi: để đạt được một vị trí cao hơn; đi lên

examples: The ship sailed across the ocean, carrying cargo from one country to another.
She sailed close to the wind when she missed work three times last week.
The strong wind urged on the sails of the boat, helping it move faster.
The boat rocked gently as we set sail on a sunny day.
I was hoping to get to bed early tonight, but clearly, that ship has sailed.
words.defineEn: to travel on water using the power of wind or an engine
words.defineVi: đi trên mặt nước bằng cách sử dụng sức gió hoặc động cơ

examples: The goalie saved Johnson's long-range shot.
Save data frequently.
But a truck driver saved her bacon.
Save your breath, Tom.
To save a penalty.
words.defineEn: to keep someone or something safe and away from harm, death, etc.
words.defineVi: để giữ cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó an toàn và tránh xa tổn hại, cái chết, vv

examples: Rugby and art seem strange bedfellows.
The vision seems a flight of fancy.
Neither one seems like the sharpest pencil in the box.
The people seem to have swallowed the government's promises hook, line, and sinker.
The company's new strategy seems to be on course, with positive results so far.
words.defineEn: to appear to be or do something particular
words.defineVi: xuất hiện hoặc làm một cái gì đó cụ thể

examples: That poor kid is shaking in his shoes up there on stage.
C’mon, shake a leg!
Afterwards I was shaking like a leaf.
John shook his head as another corporation was fined a relatively small amount for environmental damage and safety violations.
I'll be with you in two shakes.
words.defineEn: to cause someone or something to move up and down or from one side to the other with short rapid movements
words.defineVi: làm cho ai đó hoặc cái gì đó di chuyển lên xuống hoặc từ bên này sang bên kia với những chuyển động ngắn và nhanh

examples: She almost shouted bloody murder on top of her lungs.
His shout scared me witless.
I wanted to shout at the man for jumping the line, but I was too embarrassed about making a scene.
I'd shouted blue murder every time someone tried to kiss me.
Anger and shouting simply aren’t a part of his idiom.
words.defineEn: to speak in a loud voice, especially when we are angry or when we cannot hear what the other person is saying
words.defineVi: nói to, đặc biệt là khi chúng ta tức giận hoặc khi chúng ta không thể nghe thấy những gì người khác đang nói

examples: The door clicked shut behind me.
She went into her room and shut the door behind her.
When it comes to gossip, I've learned that a shut mouth catches no flies.
A door must be either shut or open.
That’s really shutting the stable door after the horse has bolted.
words.defineEn: (of a door, window, etc.) to become closed
words.defineVi: (của một cánh cửa, cửa sổ, v.v.) trở nên đóng lại

examples: The sign must be taken down.
The doctor examined her neck for any signs of injury.
I checked the car for signs of damage.
We sign our names with a pen when writing greeting cards.
The loyal subjects bowed down before their king as a sign of reverence.
words.defineEn: to write your name on something such as a check, letter, document, etc. for people to recognize it and know that you wrote it or you authorize or agree with what is written on it
words.defineVi: để viết tên của bạn trên một cái gì đó như séc, thư, tài liệu, v.v. để mọi người nhận ra nó và biết rằng bạn đã viết nó hoặc bạn cho phép hoặc đồng ý với những gì được viết trên đó

examples: I've never skied before, so here goes nothing.
We went skiing in the snowy mountains.
You're going skiing in this blizzard?
She had never been skiing before, but took the plunge and booked a lesson, knowing that there is always a first time for everything.
The young people ski all day.
words.defineEn: to move on snow on two sliding bars that are worn on the feet
words.defineVi: di chuyển trên tuyết trên hai thanh trượt được đeo ở chân

examples: The stars twinkled brightly in the dark night sky.
She counted zero stars in the sky.
The night sky is filled with stars and a beautiful moon.
In the world of sports, a star athlete can be considered a big shot.
The night sky is black, except for the stars and the moon.
words.defineEn: to act as a main character in a play, movie, etc.
words.defineVi: đóng vai một nhân vật chính trong một vở kịch, bộ phim, v.v.

examples: She stole the shoes from under the assistant's nose.
The thief stole into the house through an unlocked window.
The spy stole across the border under the cover of darkness.
This suit is a steal at $80.
They would never steal.
words.defineEn: to take something from someone or somewhere without permission or paying for it
words.defineVi: lấy thứ gì đó từ ai đó hoặc nơi nào đó mà không được phép hoặc trả tiền cho nó

examples: Little things please little minds, I suppose.
I'm just down in the doldrums a bit, I suppose.
I suppose there is no end to the depth of some people's idiocy.
I suppose what can you expect from a hog but a grunt?
Of course, I suppose 20 years does make a lot of difference.
words.defineEn: to think or believe that something is possible or true, without being sure
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ hoặc tin rằng một cái gì đó là có thể hoặc đúng, mà không chắc chắn

examples: The text runs along the margin of the page.
When designing a website or presentation, it's important to use visuals to break up text and convey information in a more engaging way - after all, a picture is worth a thousand words.

The student struggled with a challenging book, but knew that every book must be chewed to get out its juice - it was essential to persevere and put in the effort to understand and appreciate the text.
Most people always just text.
- Text a doctor.
words.defineEn: to send a written message using a cell phone
words.defineVi: để gửi một tin nhắn bằng văn bản sử dụng một điện thoại di động

examples: Which tie do you like best?
She finally loosened her tie after a long day at work.
Do I have to wear a tie?
He wore a tie to the wedding for a unique look.
She tied some strips of cloth around the wound to check the bleeding.
words.defineEn: to attach or connect two things by a rope, band, etc.
words.defineVi: để gắn hoặc kết nối hai thứ bằng một sợi dây, băng, v.v.

examples: The train’s here at long last.
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
Trains between London and Brighton run throughout the day.
To hold the train.
The slow train arrived at the station behind schedule.
words.defineEn: to be taught the skills for a particular job or activity through instruction and practice over time
words.defineVi: được dạy các kỹ năng cho một công việc hoặc hoạt động cụ thể thông qua hướng dẫn và thực hành theo thời gian

examples: The prestigious gala dinner is attended by business tycoons, philanthropists, and political leaders.
She attends a prestigious university known for its engineering program.
The conference is attended by industry leaders and big enchiladas who share their expertise and insights.
But when she held an exhibit in her hometown, few people attended.
She attends a dance class every Thursday to learn new moves.
words.defineEn: to be present at a meeting, event, conference, etc.
words.defineVi: để có mặt tại một cuộc họp, sự kiện, hội nghị, vv

examples: The police searched the suspect's house for evidence.
The hikers diligently searched the dense forest for the lost trail, using a map and compass as their guide.
With a flashlight in hand, the police officer searched for clues at the crime scene.
My grandparents immigrated to this country in search of better opportunities.
We should search for a reliable source to verify the information.
words.defineEn: to try to find something or someone by carefully looking or investigating
words.defineVi: để cố gắng tìm một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó bằng cách cẩn thận xem xét hoặc điều tra

examples: The soldiers kept the attackers at bay.
Her father kept a grocer's shop.
The big fellow keeps a fish shop near the post office.
The master kept a weekly journal.
Always keep a backup of the file.
words.defineEn: to stay or remain in a specific state, position, or condition
words.defineVi: ở lại hoặc ở lại trong một trạng thái cụ thể, vị trí, hoặc điều kiện
